section.section: Whenever the charge of constructive criminal contempt arises from an attack on the character or conduct of a judge, the defendant is entitled to recusal of the judge if the defendant files a demand for recusal before the hearing on the charge.

Whenever a defendant files a timely demand for recusal:
the judge may not proceed further; and
the presiding judge of the court shall designate another judge as a replacement.
A person who is guilty of constructive criminal contempt in a labor case is subject to a fine not exceeding $100 or imprisonment not exceeding 15 days or both.

A person who is imprisoned for failure to pay a fine imposed under this subsection shall be discharged:
after 15 days; or
if also imprisoned for a definite period, 15 days after the end of the period.
